item.title: Traci add a quote by Christopher Paolini
item.description: "Because you can't argue with all the fools in the world. It's easier to let them have their way, then trick them when they're not paying attention." -- Christopher Paolini

item.title: Traci add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Traci add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I could easily forgive his pride, if he had not mortified mine." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Traci add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: "I keep thinking about a tale my nurse used to read to me about a bird whose wings are pinned to the ground. In the end, when he finally frees himself, he flies so high he becomes a star. My nurse said the story was about how we all have something that keeps us down." -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Traci add a quote by Shannon Hale
Traci add a quote by Chris Stewart
item.description: "There are others watching over you from the other side of the veil. We watch. We listen. And we understand. We never leave your side, Azadeh. Someone is always near, someone who knows you and loves you and wants you to succeed. You are never alone. There is always someone there. Think of that, remember, and it will give you the strength that you need." -- Chris Stewart

item.title: Traci add a quote by Ernest Cline
item.description: "You'd be amazed how much research you can get done when you have no life whatsoever." -- Ernest Cline
